title: Scenario 2: Multiple Quick Tabs Global Sync
content:
Issue #47 Scenario 2: Multiple Quick Tabs and Global Synchronization

**Purpose:** Verify that multiple Quick Tabs can coexist, each maintains independent state, and all sync correctly across tabs.

**Test Location:** tests/extension/issue-47-scenarios.spec.js

**Key Test Steps:**
1. Create 3 Quick Tabs on first page
2. Verify all 3 appear on first page
3. Open second browser tab
4. Verify all 3 Quick Tabs sync to second tab
5. Verify each Quick Tab has independent position/size state

**Test Bridge Methods Used:**
- createQuickTab(url, options) - called 3 times
- getQuickTabs()
- waitForQuickTabCount(expectedCount, timeout)
- clearAllQuickTabs()

**Expected Behavior:**
- All Quick Tabs created successfully
- Each Quick Tab has unique ID
- All sync to second tab independently
- Position/size maintained independently for each

**Implementation Status:** âœ… Implemented and tested

**Test Pattern:**
```javascript
await helper1.createQuickTab('https://wikipedia.org');
await helper1.createQuickTab('https://youtube.com');
await helper1.createQuickTab('https://github.com');

const tabs1 = await helper1.getQuickTabs();
expect(tabs1).toHaveLength(3);

await helper2.waitForQuickTabCount(3, 5000);
const tabs2 = await helper2.getQuickTabs();
expect(tabs2).toHaveLength(3);
```

**Dependencies:** BroadcastChannel API, state manager
